meanings.definition: The quality or ability of being translated from one language to another.
meanings.sent1: The translatability of the document made it easy to understand in different languages.
meanings.sent2: The translatability of the poem allowed people from various cultures to appreciate its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The translatability of the joke got lost in translation, leading to confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions had a translatability that transcended language barriers.
meanings.sent5: The translatability of the manual ensured that users worldwide could follow the instructions accurately.

meanings.definition: The capacity for being expressed or understood in a different form or medium.
meanings.sent1: The translatability of the concept into a diagram helped students visualize it better.
meanings.sent2: The translatability of emotions through music is a powerful form of expression.
meanings.sent3: The translatability of the story into a movie brought it to life in a new way.
meanings.sent4: His art had a translatability that spoke to people across different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The translatability of data into graphs made the information easier to comprehend.
